results.deck: A sequel to the events of Castlevania III:  Dracula's Curse.  Hector, a devil forgemaster that fled Dracula's service, seeks revenge and must stop Isaac, another forgemaster still loyal to Dracula.
results.name: Castlevania: Curse of Darkness

results.deck: Have your own experience in the Three Kingdoms era, while playing as one of 535 available characters ranging from Ronin to Rulers. Exciting drama awaits you no matter which path you may choose.
results.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms VII

results.deck: The sequel to the original Tournament Paintball game
results.name: Greg Hastings' Tournament Paintball MAX'D

results.deck: A Europe only soccer game.
results.name: International Superstar Soccer 2

results.deck: Pro Evolution Soccer 2 marks a return of footballing fun in this second instalment of the popular sports game series.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2

results.deck: Dynasty Warriors 3: Xtreme Legends is a stand-alone expansion.
results.name: Dynasty Warriors 3: Xtreme Legends

results.deck: This is the second game in the racing series based on Lego, the popular construction toys. It was released in 2001 for Playstation 2, PC and Game Boy Advance.
results.name: LEGO Racers 2

results.deck: The Expansion for the original AC2, this package includes the original game with hundreds of new missions and hundreds of new parts
results.name: Armored Core 2: Another Age

results.deck: Ratchet & Clank: Going Commando is the sequel to Ratchet & Clank and the second game in the long-running franchise developed by Insomniac Games.
results.name: Ratchet & Clank: Going Commando

results.deck: A video game based on the Quentin Tarantino movie of the same name.
results.name: Reservoir Dogs

results.deck: Maken Shao is a Playstation 2 remake of Maken X, a game released on the Dreamcast. Both games were developed in-house by Atlus.
results.name: Maken Shao: Demon Sword

results.deck: LMA Manager 2003 is the 2002/2003 football season iteration of the football management series.
results.name: LMA Manager 2003

results.deck: Street Fighter Alpha Anthology is a PS2 compilation of the Street Fighter Alpha series. It includes the original game, the original and Gold editions of Street Fighter Alpha 2, Street Fighter Alpha 3, and the bonus title Super Gem Fighter: Mini Mix.
results.name: Street Fighter Alpha Anthology

results.deck: Kingdom Hearts II is the third installment in the Kingdom Hearts franchise following after Kingdom Hearts: Chain of Memories, known for its successful combination of Disney and Final Fantasy franchises into a believable plot.
results.name: Kingdom Hearts II

results.deck: Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku: Bonnou no Kaihou is a Japanese only fighting game for the PS2.
results.name: Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku: Bonnou no Kaihou

results.deck: The seventh installment brings the long-running Mega Man X series into full 3D, adding cel-shaded graphics, third-person platforming segments, and a new protagonist: Axl, a former vigilante (of a group that's now hunting him down) who can mimic the enemies he encounters.
results.name: Mega Man X7

results.deck: Traditional role playing game with an Old West theme.
results.name: Wild Arms 3

results.deck: Suikoden Tactics is a tactical role-playing game developed and published by Konami for the PlayStation 2 console as part of their Suikoden series.  It is the first game of the series that falls under the strategy role-playing genre.
results.name: Suikoden Tactics

results.deck: A game based on the Indy Racing Series by Codemasters.
results.name: IndyCar Series

results.deck: Frontline follows the European Theater, starting with the Normandy Beach landings.
results.name: Medal of Honor: Frontline

results.deck: Go behind the visor as players take the role of RoboCop, clearing the streets of Neo Detroit from crime.
results.name: RoboCop

results.deck: The definitive version of Virtua Fighter 4 with two new characters, more characters, and the original Virtual Fighter playable.
results.name: Virtua Fighter 4: Evolution

results.deck: MVP Baseball 2003 is the inaugural entry in EA's MVP Baseball franchise.
results.name: MVP Baseball 2003

results.deck: A character-action game based on the events of the movie "Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl."
results.name: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Legend of Jack Sparrow

results.deck: Ratchet & Clank:  Up Your Arsenal is the third game in the Ratchet and Clank series. It is also the first to include online play.
results.name: Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal

results.deck: Futuristic, sci-fi themed racing game featuring ridiculously fast motorcycles (of sorts) that can travel in excess of 1000 mph. They can also be outfitted with weapons, making each race fast and nerve-wracking.
results.name: XG3: Extreme G Racing

results.deck: Psyvariar: Complete Edition is the PS2 port of the Japanese arcade game Psyvariar. The game includes a leveling system that upgrades your ship and features enduring fights that fill the screen with thousands of bullets.
results.name: Psyvariar: Complete Edition
Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties

results.deck:
Freekstyle is a racing game released by EA Sports BIG in 2002.
As a part of the BIG series, the game focuses on the sport of motocross, and takes it to 
a more extreme level.
results.name: Freekstyle

results.deck: The eleventh entry in the King of Fighters franchise expands on the tag system found in KOF '03 and continues the story of the second "Orochi Saga."
results.name: The King of Fighters XI

results.deck: NFL Head Coach is the first game in EA's very in-depth football simulation series.
results.name: NFL Head Coach

results.deck: Phantasy Star Universe tells the story of a Guardian named Ethan Waber who is on a mission to save his sister and stop a mysterious life form known as the SEED.
results.name: Phantasy Star Universe

results.deck: This music-based puzzle game from Q Entertainment and Tetsuya Mizuguchi features contributions from numerous Japanese electronic musicians.
results.name: Lumines: Puzzle Fusion

results.deck: All-Star Baseball 2003 is a release from Acclaim on various platforms. It features Derek Jeter as the cover athlete playing for the New York Yankees.
results.name: All-Star Baseball 2003

results.deck: Players race snowmobiles around over-the-top courses throughout the world.  And shoot each other with rockets.
results.name: Arctic Thunder

results.deck: Star Trek: Encounters is a dual joystick shooter for the PS2, whose missions span across all Star Trek shows.
results.name: Star Trek: Encounters

results.deck: Christmas themed edition of the rhythm game Mad Maestro. Japan only.
results.name: Bravo Music: Christmas Edition

results.deck: A game in which you control your very own army of goblins. Players can choose between different types of units and heroes to wage war against rival hordes.
results.name: Goblin Commander: Unleash the Horde

results.deck: A game based on the Indiana Jones franchise.
results.name: Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb

results.deck: The third numbered entry in the Tengai Makyou series from Red Company and Hudson.
results.name: Tengai Makyou III: Namida
The Dukes of Hazzard: Return of the General Lee

results.deck: In Kim Possible "What's the switch", Drakken, Ron, Kim, and Shego are all trading places. That's right Shego is the teenage hero and her sidekick is Drakken. Ron is a evil scientist and Kim is his henchman. Join this exciting adventure with your favorite KP characters.
results.name: Disney's Kim Possible: What's the Switch?

results.deck: An action-adventure rollerblading game based on the eponymous popular character and her many Sanrio friends.
results.name: Hello Kitty: Roller Rescue

results.deck: Activision Anthology is a compilation that includes over 45 of the company's biggest games for the Atari 2600.
results.name: Activision Anthology

results.deck: The Dragon Ball Z manga and anime franchise comes to sixth-generation consoles in this 3D fighting game by Dimps.
results.name: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai

results.deck: Archon-like, Wrath Unleashed features strategic hex-based maneuvering followed by 3D combat in order to control territory and defeat the opposing side.  The objective is to crush the enemy completely or vanquish their god.
results.name: Wrath Unleashed

results.deck: Sea Monsters: A Prehistoric Adventure is a 3rd person underwater action adventure game where players assume the role of various extinct sea creatures based on the National Geographic 3d movie of the same name.
results.name: Sea Monsters: A Prehistoric Adventure

results.deck: NHL 07 was the 16th game of the NHL franchise from EA Sports.
results.name: NHL 07

results.deck: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time is an action-adventure game with a heavy focus on platforming. The story revolves around the wry Prince, a time-altering dagger, and a kingdom beset by a plague-like evil.
results.name: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

results.deck: A racing game centering around the Crazy Frog character.
results.name: Crazy Frog Racer

results.deck: MVP Baseball 2004 is the second game in the MVP franchise. The game built upon the successes of the original while including new features such as the addition of Minor League affiliates.
results.name: MVP Baseball 2004

results.deck: Tales of Legendia is the second full 3D game of the Tales Series. It follows Senel Coolidge and his sister Shirley, who get into a shipwreck and get stuck on a huge boat called the Legacy. Throughout the game you meet several different characters that will join your party.
results.name: Tales of Legendia

results.deck: Marvel Nemesis: Rise of the Imperfects is a third person fighting game from Marvel and EA. The game features original characters from the Marvel Universe as well as new characters made by EA.
results.name: Marvel Nemesis: Rise of the Imperfects

results.deck: Follow John Constantine as he fights to save humanity, save the earth and save his own soul.
results.name: Constantine

results.deck: A horse racing simulation game.
results.name: Breeders' Cup World Thoroughbred Championships

results.deck: Bionicle Heroes is a third-person shooter based off the popular line of toys from Lego.
results.name: Bionicle Heroes

results.deck: Fight Night 2004 is a boxing game. It includes a career, exibition, and create a fighter modes. It also includes former and current fight in all weight divisions.
results.name: Fight Night 2004

results.deck: The latest game in the Rampage series, where you take control of a giant creature and proceed to destroy cities, building by building. You battle against the evil Dr. Vector, the man responsible for turning you and other humans into these giant monsters.
results.name: Rampage: Total Destruction

results.deck: A modern turn-based tactical shooter.
results.name: Future Tactics: The Uprising

results.deck: The second visual novel in KID Corp's Infinity series.
results.name: Never7: The End of Infinity

results.deck: Formula One 04 was the first game in the series to change the gameplay mechanics and is the first Sony developed Formula 1 game to feature a career mode.
results.name: Formula One 04

results.deck: An adult-oriented BMX game published by Acclaim.
results.name: BMX XXX

results.deck: The Red Star is an action game based on a series of graphic novels. A blend of Contra-style shooting with close-quarters melee combat, The Red Star is a unique blend of the old and the new. Features co-operative play and three different characters to choose from.
results.name: The Red Star

results.deck: The evil Orochi warps time and space, pulling the greatest warriors of Three Kingdoms China and Warring States Japan to battle for his amusement.  This crossover game features most of the playable characters from Dynasty Warriors 1-5 and Samurai Warriors 1 & 2.
results.name: Warriors Orochi

results.deck: Play through the events of all three Matrix films as Neo, with an alternate ending written by the Wachowski sisters.
results.name: The Matrix: Path of Neo

results.deck: Dirge Of Cerberus delves into the mysterious past of Vincent Valentine, with plenty of explosions.
results.name: Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII

results.deck: The web-slinging, joke cracking, Spider-Man is back. The third game in the movie tie-in series sees Spider-Man battle more foes than ever and even get a new makeover, and of course,  it offers plenty of swinging around the city.
results.name: Spider-Man 3

results.deck: Fighting Vipers was released for arcades on November 1995 and for the Saturn in 1996. Features nine characters, the gameplay is fast and action-packed, arguably rivalling the Playstation's release of Tekken that came out in late 1995. Also known as the game that featured Pepsiman.
results.name: Fighting Vipers

results.deck: Sony's baseball game famous for its "The Show" mode.
results.name: MLB 06: The Show
World Series of Poker 2008: Battle for the Bracelets

results.deck: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 brings the skateboarding franchise to the sixth generation of game consoles, bringing new levels, new skaters, new tricks (such as hidden trick variations and the Revert), and online multiplayer.
results.name: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3

results.deck: Caesar has been murdered within the Roman Senate and everywhere looms conspiracy. Only Agrippa and his close friend Octavianus dare to search for the truth in this hybrid stealth-action/hack & slash title from Capcom.
results.name: Shadow of Rome

results.deck: Crackpots is a game that continues the ages old rivalry of man and bugs. Use strategically placed flower pots to squash as many bugs as possible before you are completely overrun.
results.name: Crackpots

results.deck: Space Raiders is an updated version of the classic Space Invaders game.
results.name: Space Raiders
Brave: The Search for Spirit Dancer

results.deck: High School Musical: Sing It! is a karaoke game based on Disney's smash hit High School Musical franchise, allowing players to sing their way through over 2 dozens tracks from or related to the movies.
results.name: High School Musical: Sing It!

results.deck: Worms Blast is a VS. puzzle game that uses characters and settings from the Worms Franchise
results.name: Worms Blast

results.deck:
Third game in the Broken Sword franchise. Once more, George and Nico must travel the world, wrestling danger and piecing together the clues that will unravel the secrets of the Sleeping Dragon.

Like previous Broken Sword games, Broken Sword: The Sleeping Dragon plays heavily on popular history and fantasy mythology.
results.name: Broken Sword: The Sleeping Dragon

results.deck: Hoodlum Havoc is a 3-D platformer from Ubisoft starring limbless hero Rayman. A hilarious story takes a few twists as Rayman sets out to stop the evil black lum Andre and his army of hoodlums.
results.name: Rayman 3: Hoodlum Havoc

results.deck: Frequency is a music-rhythm game for the PlayStation 2. It is the predecessor to Amplitude and is Harmonix's first game in their long lineage of console rhythm games.
results.name: Frequency

results.deck: Dog's Life is a video game for Sony's PlayStation 2, developed by Frontier Developments. It was released in Europe in 2003, North America in 2004 and Japan in 2005. It was published by Sony Computer Entertainment.
results.name: Dog's Life

results.deck: Race your way through Atlanta, San Diego and Detroit, with a variety of customized vehicles in Rockstar's 3rd game in the Midnight Club series. Re-released as Midnight Club 3: DUB Edition Remix.
results.name: Midnight Club 3: DUB Edition
The Nightmare of Druaga: Fushigino dungeon

results.deck: God Hand is a 3D third-person beat-'em-up game featuring Resident Evil-style "tank controls", irreverent humor, and over-the-top action.
results.name: God Hand

results.deck: A baseball game.
results.name: ESPN Major League Baseball
